abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was highly likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that rural
            communities can effectively and transparently manage
            resources transferred by the central level and can hire
            teachers following established procedures regardless of the
            participants' educational level. Scaling-up
            implementation of programs is important, particularly as
            demonstrated by the multi-grade methodologies model.
            Satisfactory results reached by the Project are largely due
            to a sustained continuity in project coordination. Project
            execution benefited by the application of a decentralized
            administration of project activities, with the Project
            Coordination Unit's (PCU's) main function as a
            coordinating unit rather than the main implementer of
            project activities. It is necessary to (i) provide timely
            and relevant training to personnel in the operational units
            of the Ministry responsible for the administrative and
            financial areas; and (ii) permanently assign these technical
            teams so that they can take charge of the implementation of
            project activities, rather than have staff assigned
            temporarily to activities but with the risk of constantly
            losing them to other assignments. It is beneficial for
            project execution if the Operations Manual of the Project is
            adhered to closely. The Ministry of Education (MINEDUC) must
            intensify efforts to take advantage of the favorable
            atmosphere that exists in the country to increase budgetary
            allocations destined to the education sector. The opening of
            a special account in the Bank of Guatemala and hiring United
            Nations Development Program (UNDP) as procurement agent,
            helped to ease the administrative procedures for disbursing
            resources from the loan and contributed to greater
            transparency in the procurement and hiring processes. In
            order to optimize the use of the resources and to reach the
            goals and objectives of the MINEDUC, the activities and
            programs of the Ministry should be systematic and timely.

abstracts.cdata!:
The specific objectives of the Basic
            Education Reform Project include universal coverage for the
            first three years of school; a focus on gender equity,
            bilingual education and decentralization of education
            administration to encourage greater community participation;
            and geographic focus on those areas most affected by decades
            of internal conflict before the December, 1996 Peace
            Accords. The project seeks to raise coverage and equity, the
            first component, through increased pre-primary and primary
            school enrollment in the poorest rural areas, emphasizing
            reaching indigenous groups and girls by (a) expanding the
            National Community-managed Program for Educational
            Development; (b) offering afternoon shifts in existing
            schools; and (c) expanding the "Programa de la
            Nina." The second component seeks to improve efficiency
            and quality of rural basic education, resulting in reduced
            drop-out and repetition rates, and improved student academic
            achievement, mainly by supporting bilingual and multigrade
            teaching methodologies. The third component seeks to
            strengthen the organization and management of the education
            ministry's normative and policymaking functions at the
            central level, and support functions at the intermediate and
            local levels, with community involvement in day-to-day
            school organization and management.
